intro: Godetia tenella f. atrosanguinea, commonly known as the dark crimson flaxflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its striking, deep red to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to gardens. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are slender and upright. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in warm climates for its showy blooms.
